admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The Telecommunications Project was
            highly successful in achieving its overall objective of
            improving the efficiency of telecommunications services in
            Slovak Republic. Telephone service was transformed from an
            outmoded analog network into a modern digital network. The
            number of installed telephone lines and the number of
            working lines had increased. In 2000, the public is being
            served by cellular telephone lines. The lessons learned
            include: a) The support of regulatory reforms does not end
            with the creation of the independent sector regulator. b)
            The efficient implementation of different financial
            instruments not only ensured the investment program
            financing, but more importantly, stimulated the enhancement
            of financial management skills and positive evolution of
            Slovak Telecommunications Company's (ST) corporate
            culture. c) Any privatization transaction should be preceded
            by a well designed public relations campaign and involvement
            of all current and potential stakeholders in the sector. d)
            Cofinancing arrangements should be secured as early as
            possible in project preparation. e) The early provision of
            quality technical advice to the Government for sector
            restructuring and to ST for implementation of the physical
            component, as well as the Borrower's capacity for
            absorbing and using the technical assistance, greatly
            contributed to the project sustainability. E) The need to
            follow strict procurement guidelines is perceived by some as
            an unnecessary burden.
